speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: SCENE VIII. Under the walls of Alexandria.

speaker: SCARUS
text_entry: Alarum. Enter MARK ANTONY, in a march; SCARUS, with others

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: We have beat him to his camp: run one before,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And let the queen know of our gests. To-morrow,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Before the sun shall see 's, we'll spill the blood

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That has to-day escaped. I thank you all;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: For doughty-handed are you, and have fought

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Not as you served the cause, but as 't had been

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Each man's like mine; you have shown all Hectors.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter the city, clip your wives, your friends,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Tell them your feats; whilst they with joyful tears

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Wash the congealment from your wounds, and kiss

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The honour'd gashes whole.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To SCARUS

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Give me thy hand

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Enter CLEOPATRA, attended

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To this great fairy I'll commend thy acts,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Make her thanks bless thee.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To CLEOPATRA

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: O thou day o' the world,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Chain mine arm'd neck; leap thou, attire and all,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Through proof of harness to my heart, and there

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Ride on the pants triumphing!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: Lord of lords!

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: O infinite virtue, comest thou smiling from

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: The world's great snare uncaught?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: My nightingale,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: We have beat them to their beds. What, girl!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: though grey

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Do something mingle with our younger brown, yet ha' we

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: A brain that nourishes our nerves, and can

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Get goal for goal of youth. Behold this man;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Commend unto his lips thy favouring hand:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Kiss it, my warrior: he hath fought to-day

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: As if a god, in hate of mankind, had

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Destroy'd in such a shape.

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: I'll give thee, friend,

speaker: CLEOPATRA
text_entry: An armour all of gold; it was a king's.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: He has deserved it, were it carbuncled

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Like holy Phoebus' car. Give me thy hand:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Through Alexandria make a jolly march;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Bear our hack'd targets like the men that owe them:

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Had our great palace the capacity

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: To camp this host, we all would sup together,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And drink carouses to the next day's fate,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Which promises royal peril. Trumpeters,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: With brazen din blast you the city's ear;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Make mingle with rattling tabourines;

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: That heaven and earth may strike their sounds together,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Applauding our approach.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Exeunt
